p: The coxsackie virus is a nonenveloped, linear, positive-sense single-stranded RNA virus that belongs to the family of Picornaviridae (Group IV), genus Enterovirus. These enteroviruses, which also include poliovirus and echovirus, are among the most common and important human pathogens [ 100, 101]. Coxsackie viruses are divided into group A (23 serotypes) and group B (six serotypes) viruses. In general, coxsackie viruses from group A infect the skin and mucous membranes, while viruses from group B infect the heart, pleura, pancreas, and liver [ 100].
